TopicTitle: Spaceplane vs Rocket Key Mapping for Joystick

Articles.Content:
I have an old Logitech ATK3 joystick which I use to play KSP.

My one problem is that I want different key bindings for both rocket and spaceplane gameplay.

Flying a rocket; I usually use x-axis for yaw, y-axis for pitch and z-axis (actually just two buttons) for roll.

Flying a spaceplane; I'd like to use x-axis for roll, y-axis for pitch and z-axis for yaw.

It's a bother going out to my settings and changing them every time I want to switch between gameplay modes.

Has anybody else experienced this situation?

Could there either be: a set of separate key bindings for spaceplanes and rockets OR a faster way to access my key bindings?

Thanks!

Beautiful game, by the way.

I would like the same thing, I guess this is one of the reasons I don't use my joystick much for KSP which I would otherwise like. While I'm at it I would also like some default keybindings for joysticks so we do not have to configure them to have basic functionality

Is there any development in this issue? I'm thinking of putting a probe body radially on all my planes and control it from there, but that would mess up the artificial horizon/navball. It would be nice to have a separate set of controls based on whether a vehicle has been designed in the space plane hangar, or the VAB.
